ratings.comment: He's a wonderful professor who is eager to teach you Arabic. As an intro level you will learn Arabic very well while also getting a comprehensive view of the historical significance of the Arabian world with all it has to offer. You will do well taking this class as indicated by everyone rating him whether good or bad but will have to put in effort

He is a very kind person but a good teacher he is not. Inconsistency with slides. Homework scheme is completely horrendous, you could type the right answer and get no credit. 

He is also a bit insensitive, making comments about students facial expression and comments about his expectations of students based on their cultural or religious identity.

Prof Tarek is by far the most caring and helpful to his students. He makes sure to accommodate and change the structure of the course in the best way that fits his students. Yes the HW is a lot but this is a 5-credit course which should be expected. You will be fine if you show up, put in the effort, and engage with the class.

Professor Tarek is one of the best teachers. His lectures are very clear. He explains everything beautifully.  if the students didn't finish the homework on time Professor Tarek accepts late homework, he is very respectful and kind. I enjoy going to his lecture and I can't wait for the next semester to do Arabic ARI 2 with him again!!!!

The class was tough in the beginning and there were many issues , but Dr.Ziadna was very accommodating and listened to the problems we presented him. He even let's us go to other classes for participation If we miss our class. The class is mostly based on participation and homework, so if you go to lecture and do the homework, you'll be fine.

He is one of the most caring, funniest, likable professors ive had at UB and probably the most fun i've had in a class because it is very engaging and lets you actively learn. Any issues that we've had, we brought up to him and he fixed it and even went beyond and changed the structure of the class, showing that he cares a lot. He is very kind

the class is really fun and I love talking and engaging with my other classmates in arabic even though it is early in the morning. as long as you talk and show effort your grade should reflect your effort and it is very fair. I have learned way more arabic than I thought I would and he is the best professor that i have had this semester

I have so much fun in this class and I genuinely learn Arabic by just talking. Its refreshing to have a professor who is engaging + fun + who makes Arabic worthwhile to learn. He actually cares about teaching arabic and if you have a problem he will take care of it in office hours. He is very easy to talk to and makes me look forward to a 9am class

Dr. Ziadna is an amazing professor that goes beyond what is required of him to accommodate all students regardless of their behavior/effort in the class. As long as you participate (which was fun for me), your grade in the class will be good and you will genuinely learn Arabic. One of the better professors I've had who makes arabic fun to learn!

This is a 5 credit course, so expect lots of work and homwork. Tarek is a good professor and actually makes sure you do well in his class. If you don't put in work and study outside of class, don't expect this course to be easy. I came into this class without knowing any Arabic, but thanks to him, I can now have full conversations with Arab peers.
This class and professor makes me want to get euthanized.

I've heard a lot of stories about strange professors but I never knew I would encounter 1. Get ready to: have ur homework & midterm study guides posted the day b4, no notes posted (even tho he claims "yes, inshallah"), being disrespected (called students "ugly"), & so much more. Whenever I would I say "no,I dont understand this" he would just laugh

By far the worst professor I have ever had, absolutely no professionalism or teaching abilities. Don't bother taking this class if you're not fluent in the language already. God forbid you leave class without permission or tell him you don't understand a lesson. He will either take it as a personal attack or be VERY condescending. run very far !!!!

The class is for those who already speak Arabic. Bc he knows there are students who already know Arabic, he paces quick w/ the material which is very unfair to everyone else. 1st day of class, he says speaking English won't be allowed (says he will start taking points off). Also goes over tons of phrases & excepts you to put them to use right away.

Tarek is a great TA, honestly one of the best I've had so far. Always willing to help students understand the material, and available outside of class if need be. If you're taking Arabic, try and take it with Tarek.
Really awesome guy. He teaches everything really well, and if you show up to class and pay attention, getting an A shouldn't be a problem.

One of the better Arabic teacher I know. He's funny and his class is really laid back. Of course as the semester gets moving his class gets busier but overall, it's still pretty easy for a language class.
Very smart and engaging. High expectations for students.
